main_definition: Copyrights refer to the exclusive legal right granted by a statute or common law of a government to the creator of an original work, which protects it from being used without permission.

meanings_and_examples.example: An author holds copyrights on their novel, preventing others from copying or selling the book.
A company has registered its software as a copyright to safeguard it against unauthorized reproduction.
The musician's song lyrics are protected under their copyright, ensuring they control how the work is used or distributed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Restriction on copying and distributing content
meanings_and_examples.example: A photographer has copyright over their images, which means others cannot legally use them without permission.
